description.narrative: Helsinki Policy Forum (HPF) is a dialogue process founded in February 2014 to facilitate a peaceful dialogue and understanding between politicians and other stakeholders from Europe and Middle East and North Africa (MENA) and Gulf region in order to mitiga te the tension in the region. HPF has set up its position and the network has been expanded. The dialogue meetings are attended by high-level participants from governments parliaments business world science and civil society from European countries and MEN A/Gulf region. Activities and working methods will be further developed and the network further broaden. The next Helsinki Policy Forum meeting will take place in Helsinki in spring 2019 most likely at ministerial level. The Ministry for Foreign Affairs Un it for Middle East and North Africa co-operates with the Forward Thinking -organization in arrangements of the meeting.Helsinki Policy Forum is in line with the Finnish development policy by contributing to the peaceful and functioning societies capacity b uilding of the private sectors employment and taxation capability of the countries in MENA/Gulf region. The project supports the action program of the sustainable development accepted in UN in September 2015 as well as Finland's mediation action program. H elsinki Policy Forum aims to promote confidential high-level dialogue. Helsinki Policy Forum offers the participants a dialogue forum which is secure confidential and unofficial. It aims to deepen the scrutiny of the current focal challenges and to phrase guidelines to moderate internal and regional tension and to create foundation to common solutions. Unit for the Middle East and North Africa is proposing a funding of 200 000 euros allocation scheme 2430664 (Maittain kohdentamaton kehitysyhteistyo) for fac ilitation of four meetings (annual ministerial dialogue meeting two steering committee meetings additional ministerial meeting) and to support Helsinki Policy Forum activities in general during the year 2019.
